intro: Calophysa setosa, commonly known as the slender calophysa, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with a serrated edge, and it prefers moist, shaded environments. Calophysa setosa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in wetlands and along stream banks.
